item.title: One of World of Warcraft's Biggest Entry Issues Has Yet to Be Addressed
item.description:
As World of Warcraft continues to grow with new content, so too does its playerbase. While WoW may have had a downward trend a couple of years ago, the Worldsoul Saga is seemingly righting the ship and once more cementing World of Warcraft as the king of the MMO genre. However, even with the massive improvements Blizzard has been steadily introducing, there is still one hurdle that faces new players: the game's unfriendly and dated UI.

For years, World of Warcraft players have been complaining about the game's UI. Oftentimes, players have found it to be unintuitive and ugly looking. Even with the improvements that came with Dragonflight, there still seems to be a need for UI add-ons to make the experience far more approachable. If Blizzard wants to continue to attract new players to its expansive world, then it needs to tackle this issue head-on.

World of Warcraft Has Relied on Add-Ons for Too Long

WoW's Base UI Can Be Aggravating at Times

Since World of Warcraft 's inception back in 2004, the game has mostly stuck with the same exact UI. Blizzard has changed a couple of things over the years, but instead of overhauling the experience, it has just made the entire thing more cluttered. Players have little control over its layout, things are buried in multiple menus, and it often takes players a decent amount of time to find what they are looking for. As a result, many veteran players have turned to UI add-ons to fix these issues.

With the release of Dragonflight, Blizzard finally overhauled WoW 's base UI. This was the first major overhaul in 18 years, finally giving the UI a more modern facelift. Players were given the ability to customize it more, everything was given a cleaner and more compact look, and it all works a lot better. During The War Within, the studio has updated it even more, with changes to the map, quest log, and the spellbook. However, even with these changes, some players have found that nothing beats those UI add-ons.

WoW Needs to Improve Things For New Players

If players want the best WoW UI possible, then they often have to turn to UI add-ons to get that. While veteran players will likely have no problem finding those, new players may not have the same experience. Many just want to jump into the world of Azeroth and explore everything that it has to offer, and downloading all sorts of add-ons arguably wastes time better spent playing. There are countless options to sort through and many guides debating about which ones are actually worth the download, making the entire process a bit overwhelming. Plus, the more add-ons that players have, the longer it takes to log in.

Hopefully, Blizzard has more plans to improve the UI over the next couple of updates and expansion packs. The studio has already overhauled some of the worst aspects of the UI, so now it just has to take it a step further. While players should always have the option to shake things up with World of Warcraft add-ons, they should not feel like they need to. The base UI should fill all the most important aspects, and the add-ons should simply be there for those that want to take it to the next level.

At the end of the day, the way the UI looks and feels does come down to personal preference. World of Warcraft 's base UI may be clunky and in need of some more upgrades, but it is still very much useable, and some new players may not even notice its issues. That being said, it does still lack some functionality and usability that add-ons have fixed, and Blizzard really needs to catch up with that.

item.title: 8 Best Strategy Games To Pass The Time On Long Flights
item.description:
Summary

  • Pass time on flights with immersive strategy games like Civilization 6, Age of Empires 2, and Crusader Kings 3.
  • These games offer captivating gameplay that eats up hours, perfect for long flights.
  • Players can lose track of time as they build empires, complete quests, and manage colonies in these strategy games.

Unless a passenger is exhausted when they board an airplane, a flight can be ridiculously boring if someone is alone during a long journey. Thankfully, there are many ways to pass time. Gamers will love to whip out a portable system and clock in some hours on the video game of their choice.

Players who want time during a flight to breeze by will love checking out a strategy game that is immersive and will captivate players in no time. Some of these strategy games are so interesting that players won't even realize that the hours have flown by before a landing announcement catches them by surprise.

8 Civilization 6

An Addictive Grand Strategy Game That's Easy To Get Into

A captivating strategy game that most people are quite familiar with, any title in the Civilization series serves as the perfect entry into the grand strategy genre. The compelling gameplay and unique recurring elements of this series are enough to keep fans coming back for more.

Civilization 6 is an excellent entry in the series. Fans can start a playthrough only to be sucked into the gameplay for hours on end. It's the perfect game for a flight, and lets players roleplay as the ruler of their choice as they establish superiority with the country they're controlling.

7 Age Of Empires 2

A Classic RTS Game That Is Jam-Packed With Content

It's amazing to see that Age of Empires 2 is still being supported to this day. New campaigns and civilizations are constantly being added to the title to let long-time fans enjoy new content whenever they return to this title.

This means that players can have a great time playing this game on a flight and checking out the many new campaigns added to the experience. Players will love helping their heroes achieve their goals as they make slow yet steady progress in each scenario, with the hours flying by on a plane as players are absorbed in this experience.

6 Crusader Kings 3

Every Playthrough Feels Unique

Crusader Kings 3 is a massive achievement for Paradox Interactive. It somehow manages to retain the complexity of the series, while easing new players into the experience. It's easy to see why this title has become one of the highest-selling Paradox grand strategy games of all time.

The mix of kingdom management and role-playing gameplay is a tantalizing combination that keeps fans coming back for more, especially with the frequency of updates. Players who boot up Crusader Kings 3 during a flight will find it hard to tear themselves away from the screen, even after their flight lands.

5 RimWorld

Players Who Weather The Steep Learning Curve Will Find A Lot To Love

RimWorld is a complex colony simulation game with deep strategic gameplay that can be unforgiving for beginners. However, every loss should be treated like a learning opportunity, as players understand what went wrong and how to avoid these negative situations.

Eventually, players will become adept at playing this game as they check out other storytellers to spice up the gameplay. Players well-versed with RimWorld can easily start it up during a flight, either choosing to take care of an existing colony or starting a new playthrough instead.

4 Age Of Mythology

The Remaster Offers A Nostalgic RTS With A Fresh Coat Of Paint

Age of Mythology is one of the most nostalgic and beloved RTS games of all time. It's easy to see why fans were hyped for Retold 's release. Players love the visual and gameplay upgrades, which do a great job of modernizing the experience without compromising any of the game's classic allure.

A standout element of Age of Mythology is its epic campaigns that tell riveting stories. Each scenario is a joy to complete. Players can aid Arkantos in his epic quest, or check out the Atlantean storyline that lets players mess around with Titans. It's easy to see why players will have no problems playing this game on a long flight, as they make a ton of progress in these campaigns by the time they reach their destination.

3 Factorio

A Complicated Yet Engaging Factory Simulation Game

A complex factory management game where players must strategize to optimize their workflow and defend against alien assaults, Factorio is not a game for impatient players. The gameplay systems can be a bit obtuse at times, and may confuse players who just want to enjoy a simple time with a strategy game.

However, Factorio veterans can boot up this game wherever they want and have a great time ensuring that their factory is working as smoothly as possible. This makes it the perfect choice to play on a long flight where players are starved for entertainment.

2 Stellaris

An Enthralling Sci-fi Grand Strategy Game

Stellaris is one of the most ambitious and engaging grand strategy games made by Paradox Interactive. It's easy for players to lose themselves in this game for hours as they familiarize themselves with the gameplay systems along with the original worldbuilding and lore.

Long-time players have had mixed opinions over some of the gameplay changes since its launch, but Stellaris continues to stand out as a feature-rich grand strategy game. The hours will fly by on a flight as players aim to establish galactic superiority by any means necessary.

1 Balatro

A Dangerously Addictive Roguelike Spin On Poker

A roguelike deckbuilding strategy game that took over the world by storm, it's easy to see why players can't get enough of Balatro . This game takes the simple game of poker and combines it with other elements to make for a tantalizing experience that will keep fans coming back for more.

Playing this game on a flight is a no-brainer for people who want to be entertained for a long journey. Chances are that players will be in the middle of a promising run right when they're about to land, which can add to the tension of a playthrough.

item.title: Stalker 2: Gray's Last Hunt Side Quest Walkthrough
item.description:
The side quests feature some of the best content Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl has to offer. Gray's Last Hunt side quest is no different, during which players get a chance to go toe-to-toe with a unique mutant boss called the Hornhead. It's a really tough mutant to beat, given how the bullets just bounce off the parts of its body that are covered in armored scales. However, there's a way to take it down quickly; let's discuss how.

How To Start Gray's Last Hunt Quest in Stalker 2

Players can start Gray's Last Hunt side mission right after completing the Dark Times main mission in Stalker 2 . You'll need to head back to the Pile Driver POI in the Red Forest region and talk to Arkhyp Lichen about Gray's job. He'll share how Freedom stashed some loot in a boar cave, but another mutant arrived at the location and chased everyone out.

The mission is to track the mysterious mutant and get a huge reward for it. Once the dialog is over, you'll need to head west to the objective marker to track down the mutant. Once you arrive at the open field, Hornhead will appear, leading to a fight with the mutant.

Beating the Hornhead Mutant

Hornhead is an armored mutant that resembles a moose but with a disfigured body. It's got sharp horns and armor scales on its body that will ricochet bullets while inflicting insignificant damage to it. During the fight with the Hornhead, boars, rodents, and blind dogs will also spawn in the area, making the fight a lot trickier.

Hornhead will use the following attacks on the players.

  • Horn Charge : The mutant will frequently lower its head and charge at the players with horns pointed at them. If hit, the attack will stagger players and make them fall to the ground.
  • Roar : It's a rarer attack than the horn charge, during which the mutant will get on its hind legs and unleash a powerful roar that can disorient players as well as (potentially) summon more mutants to guard it.

The best weapon to use against the Hornhead is a shotgun , most preferably a Saiga D-12. It's best to target the beast on the neck or either on the head, right under its big horns. Landing enough shots will bring the Hornhead mutant down. Once it's down, make sure to loot the stashes in a cave nearby for some additional loot.

As you're leaving the area, Arkhyp will radio Skif and reward him with 18000 coupons as a reward . This will mark Gray's Last Hunt side quest in Stalker 2 as complete.

item.title: NBA 2K25: Best Teams For Small Forward In MyCareer
item.description:
Summary

  • Nets need help scoring, with room for a starting role.
  • Bulls require depth at small forward, potential for trade.
  • Warriors offer a clear path to starting, Wiggins not solid.

The small forward is a position that is often not talked about enough in the NBA, and this applies to its place in NBA 2K25 as well. While everyone can discuss the point guards and fawn over the centers effectively, it's probably going to take some time to find a person who can aptly name the small forwards of the league. However, this doesn't mean that the small forward is any less important to a team's chemistry in a game. Much like the power forward, the small forward is a nice compromise between the center and the guards, offering greater strength than a guard with quicker speed than a center.

This blending of the two means that a small forward can often be a great option for players looking to break into the MyCareer mode of the game with their built character. It takes off the pressure of having to run the offense as a point guard and push your way through the paint as a big man. Plus, being able to excel at any location on the court cannot be understated. Now, not every team is going to be looking for a small forward when a player enters the league, which means there are only a few that are going to be your best bet.

Updated January 18, 2025 by Shane Black: As the NBA season enters its halfway mark, more teams have emerged in need of help at the small forward position. Because of this, this list was updated to provide further context to the teams already on the list but also add teams who have shown to be in need. It also received more in-text links to other guides to help players even more and give them the best possible chance to dominate the league.

1 Brooklyn Nets

Needing All The Help They Can Get

  • The Nets need a lot of help in their scoring
  • Clear path for a starting role
  • A young team that is rebuilding

The Brooklyn Nets are not a good team, to be blunt. As such, they need a lot of help and have a ton of openings for players to become starters. Though they have Bojan Bogdanovic, he is not lighting the score sheet up by any means, and a new player who can score with efficiency can easily overtake him in the line-up.

While there won't be immediate success with the Nets, they do have a future through their current rebuild . Getting in on the ground floor can be a great benefit for the player.

2 Chicago Bulls

Small Forwards Very Much Needed

  • Lavine is constantly in trade talks
  • In desperate need of depth at the position
  • Could see some success coming their way

The Bulls is a weird team to recommend, but there is logic to it: their starting small forward, Zach Lavine, has been the face of the team for a long time, but his name has been tossed around in trade talks for quite some time as well . When a player's name appears so often when discussing trades, it usually signifies some real possibility of that trade happening.

But even if that trade doesn't happen, being a bench player on this team wouldn't be a bad thing as there would still be a ton of playing time. The team has some flaws, but they have enough talent to make something happen with the right moves. Getting a new small forward who can back Lavine, or take over for him once he's traded, could be just what they need to have some relevance come back to the storied franchise.

3 Golden State Warriors

A Clear Path To Starting

  • Andrew Wiggins can easily be overcome on the depth chart
  • Curry's presence means easier defenses to go against
  • A good mix of young and experienced vets to make a playoff run

Despite his prominent role in the Warriors' 2022 championship run, Andrew Wiggins has returned to earth. While far from a true detriment on the court, Wiggins has certainly opened the door for another player to come to the team and take that starting role from him. With the team struggling overall to score and keep a lead, a new small forward that can be productive would do a lot for them.

It won't be an immediate starting position , but with the right play, it won't last very long at all. If players can fulfill their roles effectively, providing the defense and shooting abilities that Wiggins showed flashes of, then they will see their roles elevated in no time.

4 Houston Rockets

A Good Fit For Starters Or Bench

  • Even bench players can contribute significantly
  • A rising team that could emerge as playoff perennials
  • Dillon Brooks is fallible and can be benched

The Houston Rockets are in a different kind of situation because Dillon Brooks is their starting small forward, and he has shown to be a solid option at that position. His calling card is his defense and ability to get into the head of his opponent, while he can also provide some offense sporadically.

However, his offensive production is not nearly enough to solidify him as a permanent fixture in that starting line. If a player can come in and match his defense while also providing more consistent offense than him, then a starting role will open up. Plus, the Rockets are on an upward trajectory and a player can get in on the ground floor here to see success for the future.

5 Los Angeles Lakers

Play With The King

  • Lebron can always generate playmaking
  • Besides AD, the Lakers need consistent scoring
  • A fringe playoff team

The Lakers have once again found themselves in a weird situation: they are not awful, but they are also not great. Because of this, the team is sitting in a place where they will be in the Play-In games come the NBA playoffs. To get themselves out of that spot, they could use a small forward to elevate their scoring.

Lebron is technically the small forward, but he really doesn't belong to one position. So having him on the court, along with AD and a new small forward , could be a potent combination to bring the team to a more consistent place.

6 Minnesota Timberwolves

A Rising Contender With Plenty Of Playing Time

  • A guaranteed second-string role
  • Wolves are rising as a top team in the league
  • A starting role isn't too far away

The Timberwolves are showing that they are here to stay in the NBA after their run to the Western Conference Finals last season. When it comes to small forwards, as well, there is certainly a need for depth . While Jayden McDaniels is their starter and will stay that way for the foreseeable future, their second-string small forward is Joe Ingles. Ingles has been a staple of the league for a while and is getting older. McDaniels has not been quite as effective as fans were hoping for, meaning that should a younger, quicker player come to the team, he could see his role moved to the second string and Ingle made irrelevant.

McDaniels is going to be the starter for a while , but not forever. If a player can have patience and give it a season or two, they could see a starting spot open up sooner rather than later.

7 Orlando Magic

A Good Spot To Contribute Early

  • Franz Wagner hasn't taken the starting role for himself
  • Lots of young talent on the team
  • A bench spot is guaranteed

The Orlando Magic have been knocking at the door of success for a couple of years now, and they just haven't been able to break through. This could easily change with the addition of a strong small forward that can elevate the team around them . Right now, Franz Wagner has the starting spot for this role and has not done a ton to cement his status there. While he has had flashes of excellence, he just hasn't been consistent enough to make fans say he is the unanimous choice to have there. And with his injury causing him to miss extended time, the door is open for another player.

This means a new small forward has a real shot of taking that starting spot from Wagner , provided they can do what he does and even more. This isn't too difficult and could see the Magic becoming a solid team that can make some noise come playoff time.

8 Toronto Raptors

A Solid Bench Role

  • Scottie Barnes has the starting spot, but the team needs depth
  • Bruce Brown hasn't reached his Nuggets level
  • A young team that can develop

The Toronto Raptors have their starting small forward, which may turn some players off. However, t he bench spot is certainly up for grabs and will bring solid minutes. Bruce Brown is currently on the bench as a small forward, but he has yet to reach the levels he did when he helped the Nuggets win a championship two years ago.

Being a consistent bench player is nothing to scoff at , and with the young talent on the roster, the players could quickly see the team become far more potent in the East.

item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for January 19, 2025
item.description:
Strands has a whole new puzzle for fans of word puzzles to try out. In order to win, you just need to figure out the theme for today's puzzle, then try to find words that fit in that theme in the letter grid. If you want to win, you might be looking for a little or a lot of help.

In this article, you can find everything you need to solve this one except the rules of how to play Strands . In this article are things like general hints, spoilers for individual words, and even the whole answer to the puzzle if you want it.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #322 January 19, 2025

The Strands puzzle for today has eight items to find: the Spangram and the seven themed words. The clue for this one is I Get the Message .

New York Times Games Strands Clues

If you don't like the in-game hints in this browser-based puzzle game because they give too much away, you can find spoiler-free clues to the theme in the three sections below. Each one contains just one little hint; uncover them with the Read More button below each header.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

If a spoiler would help you out, you should check out the two sections below. It can be a pain to save up non-themed words to uncover these hints in game, so this article has them for you, no word searching needed.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

If you want to see the full answer to this puzzle game, you can find it below. Open the following section with the Read More button, and it will uncover the Spangram, the themed words, and where they all go in the puzzle grid.

Today's Strands Explained

Don't get this free-to-play PC game even though you finished it? The section below has a full breakdown of how the Spangram, the themed words, and the clue all fit together to make sense.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.
